main event: A UFO sighting near Saginaw, Michigan on August 6, 1955, lasting for 1 hour and 12 minutes, described a rectangular, white object the size of a baseball held at arm's length, which was seen to move slightly.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by a civilian and categorized as a ground-visual observation.
Balloons released by the University of Minnesota and General Mills in Mobile, Minnesota were mentioned in relation to the sighting.
The observed object was described as relatively small and white, with slight movement.
The observation lasted for an extended period of 1 hour and 12 minutes.
A check with the CONAD weather balloon program revealed that all released balloons were drifting in the direction of the sighting.
